description:
'''Baltimore club''', also called '''B'more club''', '''B'more house''' or simply '''B'more''', is a music genre that fuses [[breakbeat]] and [[House music|house]]. It was created in [[Baltimore]] in the early 1990s by  [[Frank Ski]], Scottie B, Shawn Caesar, DJ Technics, DJ Class, DJ Patrick, Kenny B, among others.

Baltimore club is based on an 8/4 beat structure, and includes tempos around 130 beats per minute. It combines repetitive, looped vocal snippets similar to [[Trap music (hip hop)|trap]], [[bounce music|bounce]], [[ghetto house]] and [[ghettotech]] . The instrumental tracks include heavy breakbeats and [[call and response (music)|call and response]] stanzas similar to those found in the [[go-go]] music of neighboring city [[Washington, D.C.]] The most prominent [[breakbeats]] sampled include "[[Sing Sing (song)|Sing Sing]]" by [[disco]] band "Gaz" and "[[Think (About It)]]" by [[Lyn Collins]].
